Tetris.mods.Machines package¶

Submodules¶

Tetris.mods.Machines.MCMachine module¶

class Tetris.mods.Machines.MCMachine.MicroMCMachine(maxtime=0.1, proc_num=None)[source]¶

Bases: Tetris.mods.Machines.Machine.Machine

MicroMCMachine is an Monte Carlo machine that samples Q from micro actions.

This machine has a Markov Property. i.e. can be deployed to random state with no history.

Parameters:
  • maxtime (float) – maximum computation time
  • proc_num (int) – number of processes to use when MC algorithm runs
maxtime = None¶

Maximum computation time

evaluate(N=1000)¶

sequential_evaluate() evaluates expected return of start state given policy. This method does not use multiprocessing.

Simulate a game with N many games and return mean and variance of returns.

Parameters:N (int) – number of roll-outs
Returns result:(mean(return), var(return))
Return type:tuple
initialize()[source]¶

initialize() spawns proc_num many workers and starts them.

default_Pi(state)[source]¶

default_Pi() is a policy used during MC simulation.

Parameters:state (tuple) – board state in a tuple form. See Tetris.mods.Board.Board.S() for details.
Returns pi:probability distribution of actions. must sum to 1.
Return type:list
Pi(state)[source]¶

Pi() returns a probability distribution of actions given state. This method does not run any time-consuming code. Instead, it directs workers to run simulations, gathers data, and returns maximal action.

Parameters:state (tuple) – board state in a tuple form. See Tetris.mods.Board.Board.S() for details.
Returns pi:probability distribution of actions. must sum to 1.
Return type:list

Bases: Tetris.mods.Machines.Machine.Machine

MicroMCMachine is an Monte Carlo machine that samples Q from micro actions.

This machine has a Markov Property. i.e. can be deployed to random state with no history.

Parameters:
  • maxtime (float) – maximum computation time
  • proc_num (int) – number of processes to use when MC algorithm runs

maxstep = None¶

Maximum step to look ahead

Tetris.mods.Machines.Machine module¶

class Tetris.mods.Machines.Machine.Machine(proc_num=None)[source]¶

Bases: object

Machine is an abstract base class for Tetris agents.

Pi() must be implemented.

minf = -inf¶
maxf = inf¶
proc_num = None¶

Number of processes to use when MC algorithm runs

workers = None¶

List of multiprocessing.Process instances which are workers

Queues = None¶

List of queue.Queue to order workers

resQ = None¶

A queue.Queue instance to get results. All workers put results to here.

spawn_workers()[source]¶

spawn_workers() spawns workers if no worker exists, and do nothing if workers exist.

Use this method in advance any MC algorithm runs.

kill_workers()[source]¶
sequential_evaluate(N=1000)[source]¶

sequential_evaluate() evaluates expected return of start state given policy. This method does not use multiprocessing.

Simulate a game with N many games and return mean and variance of returns.

Parameters:N (int) – number of roll-outs
Returns result:(mean(return), var(return))
Return type:tuple
Pi(state)[source]¶

Pi() returns a probability distribution of actions given state.

Parameters:state (tuple) – board state in a tuple form. See Tetris.mods.Board.Board.S() for details.
Returns pi:probability distribution of actions. must sum to 1.
Return type:list
evaluate(N=10000)[source]¶

evaluate() evaluates expected return of start state given policy.

Simulate a game with N many games and return mean and variance of returns.

Parameters:N (int) – number of roll-outs
Returns result:(mean(return), var(return))
Return type:tuple
MC_V(state, maxtime=None, N=None)[source]¶

MC_V() calculates Value of a state using Monte Carlo method. Stopping condition of Monte Carlo simulation can be given in two ways: maxtime and N.

Parameters:
  • maxtime (float) – maximum computation time
  • N (int) – number of roll-outs
Returns result:

(mean(return), var(return))
Return type:

tuple
MC_Q(state, action, maxtime=None, N=None)[source]¶

MC_Q() calculates Value of a state-action using Monte Carlo method. Stopping condition of Monte Carlo simulation can be given in two ways: maxtime and N.

Parameters:
  • maxtime (float) – maximum computation time
  • N (int) – number of roll-outs
Returns result:

(mean(return), var(return))
Return type:

tuple
worker(Q, resQ, machine)[source]¶

worker() is a method that executed MC algorithms. It takes a request from Q, and run it.

Possible requests are:

  1. from MC_V()
  2. from MC_Q()

According to input type and shape, it executes following:

  1. If None, terminate.
  2. If 0, stop any MC algorithm.
phi(state)[source]¶

phi() encodes state tuple into (2, 22, 10) tensor.

Parameters:state (tuple) – board state in a tuple form. See Tetris.mods.Board.Board.S() for details.
Return phi:binary (2, 22, 10) state tensor
Return type:numpy.ndarray
heuristic_V(S)[source]¶

heuristic_V() evaluates Value of a state heuristically.

Parameters:S (numpy.ndarray) – binary (2, 22, 10) state tensor
Return V:heuristic value
Return type:int or float

Tetris.mods.Machines.NeuralMachine module¶

class Tetris.mods.Machines.NeuralMachine.NeuralMachine(name, batch_size=128)[source]¶

Bases: Tetris.mods.Machines.Machine.Machine

model = None¶

Neural network for machine.

f = None¶

theano.function instance which is called in Pi(). Takes (1, 2, h, w) tensor and outputs (5,) tensor.

S = None¶

theano.tensor variable which is an input of neural network. It is a (None, 2, h, w) tensor.

P = None¶

theano.tensor variable which is an output of neural network. It can be policy for CNNPolicyMachine or value for CNNValueMachine.

pi = None¶

theano.tensor variable which is an output policy of neural network. For PolicyMachine, pi and P can be identical.

params = None¶

list variable which is a list of trainable parameter of neural networks.

batch_size = None¶

Size of batch to be used during training.

name = None¶

Name of machine. Used to save weights.

evaluate(N=1000)¶

sequential_evaluate() evaluates expected return of start state given policy. This method does not use multiprocessing.

Simulate a game with N many games and return mean and variance of returns.

Parameters:N (int) – number of roll-outs
Returns result:(mean(return), var(return))
Return type:tuple
build_model()[source]¶

build_model() specifies model architecture.

compile_model(lr=0.01)[source]¶

compile_model() is a widely used compilation function. This procedure is necessary only when Keras fit function is used.

Parameters:lr (float) – learning rate of Adadelta optimizer
load_weights()[source]¶

load_weights() loads weight from binary file. File name is attained from its class name and architecture.

For example, ‘CNNPolicyMachine_20x4’

save_weights()[source]¶

save_weights() save weight to binary file. File name is attained from its class name and architecture.

For example, ‘CNNPolicyMachine_20x4’

Pi(state)[source]¶

Pi() returns a probability distribution of actions given state. For NeuralMachine, this is done by calling f.

Parameters:state (tuple) – board state in a tuple form. See Tetris.mods.Board.Board.S() for details.
Returns pi:probability distribution of actions. must sum to 1.
Return type:list
load_dataset()[source]¶

load_dataset() loads trajectory data. Trajectory is a tuple of (S, A, R, S’). Thus, it sets X, A, Y, R, Xp.

  1. X : (None, 2, h, w), float32
  2. A : (None, ), int32
  3. Y : (None, 5), float32
  4. R : (None, ), float32
  5. Xp : (None, 2, h, w), float32
class Tetris.mods.Machines.NeuralMachine.CNNPolicyMachine(name='CNNPolicyMachine', batch_size=2048)[source]¶

Bases: Tetris.mods.Machines.NeuralMachine.NeuralMachine

CNNPolicyMachine is machine with CNN based Policy approximating machine.

Parameters:
  • name (str) – name of machine
  • batch_size (int) – size of batch to be used during training
instantiate()[source]¶

instantiate() instantiates neural network. It builds model and set tensor parameters including S, P, pi, and params. Also, the function f is compiled. After building model, it loads model weights.

build_model()[source]¶

build_model() specified model architecture.

Returns model:keras model
Return type:keras.models
train(nb_epoch=10)[source]¶

train() is a special training function for CNNPolicyMachine.

Since CNNPolicyMachine has a policy-approximating model, train the model just like solving a classification problem.

Parameters:nb_epoch (int) – number of epoch
class Tetris.mods.Machines.NeuralMachine.CNNValueMachine(name='CNNValueMachine', batch_size=1024, v_to_pi='softmax', epsilon=0.1)[source]¶

Bases: Tetris.mods.Machines.NeuralMachine.NeuralMachine

CNNValueMachine is machine with CNN based Value approximating machine.

Parameters:
  • name (str) – name of machine
  • batch_size (int) – size of batch to be used during training
  • v_to_pi (str) – way to get pi from Value. (‘greedy’ or ‘softmax’ or ‘e-greedy’)
  • epsilon (float) – epsilon value to be used when v_to_pi is ‘e-greedy’
q = None¶

theano.function instance which calculates Q of actions. Takes (None, 2, h, w) tensor and outputs (None, 5) tensor.

v_to_pi = None¶

Way to get pi from Value. (‘greedy’ or ‘softmax’ or ‘e-greedy’)

epsilon = None¶

Epsilon value to be used when v_to_pi is ‘e-greedy’

instantiate()[source]¶

instantiate() instantiates neural network. It builds model and set tensor parameters including S, P, pi, and params. Also, the function f and q are compiled. After building model, it loads model weights.

build_model()[source]¶

build_model() specified model architecture.

Returns model:keras model
Return type:keras.models
get_pi_from_v(Q)[source]¶
class Tetris.mods.Machines.NeuralMachine.CNNActorCriticMachine(name='CNNActorCriticMachine', batch_size=2048)[source]¶

Bases: Tetris.mods.Machines.NeuralMachine.NeuralMachine

CNNActorCriticMachine is machine with CNN based actor-critic machine. Actor is a model which approximates Policy, while critic is a model which approximates Value.

Parameters:
  • name (str) – name of machine
  • batch_size (int) – size of batch to be used during training
S2 = None¶

theano.tensor variable which is an input of neural network. It is a (None, 2, h, w) tensor.

P2 = None¶

theano.tensor variable which is an output of neural network. It can be policy for CNNPolicyMachine or value for CNNValueMachine.

instantiate()[source]¶

instantiate() instantiates neural network. It builds model and set tensor parameters including S, P, pi, and params. Also, the function f and q are compiled. After building model, it loads model weights.

build_model()[source]¶

build_model() specified model architecture.

S, P, pi, and params are set. f is compiled.
